page.title: 11Inns in Dedham
page.content: The Marlborough Head is part of an old clothier's house, built before 1500. The cellars which once held dyeing vats now hold beer barrels. In 1702 it became an inn named after the Duke of Marlborough. It is run by Jacky and Brian Wills, who are praised in guide books for their excellent meals and sandwiches. The Anchor on Dedham Heath is run by James Rouch who is also the author of many novels of war and adventure. Other inns are the Rose and Crown in Crown Street, the Lamb at Lamb Corner, a very old inn, and the Black Horse by the river at Stratford St Mary with a popular garden and a good darts team.
